page.title: 07BRANSCOMBE FORGE.
page.content: There were two forges in the smithy until one of the chimneys was taken down. The old smith's cottage used to be where the garage stands. Up until 1930 the jobs included shoeing, sharpening and general repairs.Farmers usually worked at least five or six horses,.and had a horse and trap to go to Honiton market. Other things that were made included ploughs, drag harrows,metal tyres, axe heads and pig rings.To shoe a horse would cost two shillings(ten pence). Outside the forge is a metal base used for holding a wooden wheel while a metal tyre was put on.Today the forge is still in use but more often the farrier takes a portable forge to the customers.At the present time there is a lady farrier working at the forge.
